column2: 3. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column6: enter one of the blind spots and wait.

column2: 4. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.

column6: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column10: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column4: The traffic signal is not operational

column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
column8: Yield to motorcyles, but not to bicycles
column10: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles

column2: 10. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.

column6: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.

column2: 13. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column6: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.
column8: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column10: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.

column2: 20. A steady yellow light means that a ______ light will soon appear.

column4: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.

column2: 24. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.

column2: 25. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If aÂ car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: wait for the next green light.
column6: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
